page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: The new Woodmancote Village Hall was opened in June 1968 to take over from the old hall which had become too small for the various activities done there. It is used by Cubs,Brownies,a karate club and a dancing class which use it on Monday, Tuesday and Friday evenings. Also, every morning in term time there is a playgroup. Behind the Village Hall there is a large recreation ground which is used by the local Football and Cricket Clubs and doubles as a playground for local children. Besides having its own car-park, the hall was extended by the Woodmancote Society in 1979 to give room for a new kitchen and a lavatory.
